items.details:
Reading

The story this week is 'Why sun & moon live in the sky. It is a Myth. 

Please watch the video until you understand the story.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BSAknmmJv1M 

Complete the definition paper before WEDNESDAY.

The spelling test for this FRIDAY is the following words:

atmosphere
brilliant
convince
endure
glance
harsh
plunge
precious
swift
unite

Let's make our own origin Myth

Think of a title for your own myth. You can make your own idea or choose one of the examples below.

We will start writing our stories together in class tomorrow.

Here are some example titles to give you ideas:

Why the Stars Twinkle
How the Elephant Got Its Long Trunk
Why the Ocean Has Waves
Why the Birds Sing in the Morning
How the Mountains Were Made
Why the Tiger Has Stripes
How Fireflies Got Their Light
Why the Turtles Move Slowly
How the First Rainbow Appeared
Why the Sun Smiles Every Morning
Why the Cactus Has Thorns
How the First Butterfly Came to Be
(You can use one of these or make your own)

If you choose one of my examples, please comment on this post so no one else does the same one!

Example Myth stories

How the rainbow was made
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S2W42HzDo1A

Why the Sky is far away
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mLmBR0s8TY8

Why the sea is salty
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b7GJIzjXlJ4 

Extra reading

Please go to ReadWorks and complete some of the stories assigned. They will help you with you work in school and also improve your overall reading.

Go to www.readworks.org/student 

Enter our class code YU6GQ2
Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it

Math

Complete Additional Practice 4-4

Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night at https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9E to help strengthen their skills.

Science

Read pages 56-65 and complete the quiz about electric forces (Due Wednesday)

On Wednesday, we’ll be trying some fun experiments to learn about positive and negative charges!
Please bring these items if you can:

2 balloons
Some string
Plastic wrap (a small piece is fine)
A piece of wool cloth (or something similar, like a wool sock or small scarf)
Small pieces of paper
A small piece of aluminum foil
  We’ll have lots of fun seeing how positive and negative charges work in real life!  

Social Studies

Read and complete pages 48-53

Reading
The story this week is 'Why sun & moon live in the sky. It is an origin Myth. 

Please watch the video until you understand the story.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BSAknmmJv1M 

Complete the definition paper before TOMORROW.

The spelling test for this FRIDAY is the following words:

atmosphere
brilliant
convince
endure
glance
harsh
plunge
precious
swift
unite

Let's make our own origin Myth

You need to PLAN your origin myth now! Think of the story and make some notes! We will talk about your story in class tomorrow.  Don't start the poster or comic yet today, just think of some ideas. (Show me a rough plan TOMORROW)

Think of a title for your own myth. You can make your own idea or choose one of the examples below.

We will start writing our stories together in class tomorrow.

Here are some example titles to give you ideas:

Why the Stars Twinkle
How the Elephant Got Its Long Trunk
Why the Ocean Has Waves
Why the Birds Sing in the Morning
How the Mountains Were Made
Why the Tiger Has Stripes
How Fireflies Got Their Light
Why the Turtles Move Slowly
How the First Rainbow Appeared
Why the Sun Smiles Every Morning
Why the Cactus Has Thorns
How the First Butterfly Came to Be
(You can use one of these or make your own)

If you choose one of my examples, please comment on this post so no one else does the same one!

Example Myth stories

How the rainbow was made
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S2W42HzDo1A

Why the Sky is far away
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mLmBR0s8TY8

Why the sea is salty
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b7GJIzjXlJ4 

Extra reading

Please go to ReadWorks and complete some of the stories assigned. They will help you with you work in school and also improve your overall reading.

Go to www.readworks.org/student 

Enter our class code YU6GQ2
Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it

Math

Complete Additional Practice 4-5

Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night at https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9E to help strengthen their skills.

Science

Read pages 56-65 and complete the quiz about electric forces (Due Wednesday)

On Wednesday, we’ll be trying some fun experiments to learn about positive and negative charges!
Please bring these items if you can:

2 balloons
Some string
Plastic wrap (a small piece is fine)
A piece of wool cloth (or something similar, like a wool sock or small scarf)
Small pieces of paper
A small piece of aluminum foil
  We’ll have lots of fun seeing how positive and negative charges work in real life!  

Social Studies

Watch the videos that explain Natural, Human, and Capital Resources

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b8uJQPo8yq0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zEcw8rgNrVs  

Tomorrow we will have an activity to see how much you know about all these resources.

Chinese

Log in and practice the Chinese language online

Language Arts

Complete pages 50-53 in the Vocabulary Workshop book. (THURSDAY)

Use some online activities to help.

https://www.sadlierconnect.com/anonymous/product/vw?productId=35&programId=259&subjectId=1&gradeId=6&programTOCId=3229&programSeriesId=1&hash=dW5kZWZpbmVk
